author: Special Correspondent
text:
Bharathidasan University has opted to tap green energy by establishing a couple of solar power plants on its Khajamalai campus in the city.

A 50 kWp solar power plant has been installed atop the Institute for Entrepreneurship and Career Development (IECD) and another 50 kWp plant on Bharathidasan University Technology Park (BUTP) building. The university had awarded the BHEL, Bengaluru, the work order for establishing the solar power plants at two places and conducted trial runs for one month. A sum of Rs. 1.05 crore has been spent for setting up the facility inside the sprawling Khajamalai campus.

The solar plants were set up with financial assistance from the IECD and BUTP.

Inaugurating the solar power plants on Friday, Vice-Chancellor V.M. Muthukumar described it as a milestone in the institution’s history.

The setting up of the facility demonstrated the importance the university had accorded to the green initiative to protect the environment by harnessing solar power and in saving power bills in the longer run, he said.The university, he said, had planned to set up a 500 kWp solar plant on its main campus on the city’s outskirts in the near future.

IECD Director K. Parthasarathy, Director in-charge BUTP Dr. Gopinath Ganapathy, two Syndicate Members of the University, and Vipindas from BHEL, Bengaluru, spoke.
title: University goes solar
